quizzes.question: Which big white castle is over 370 years old?
quizzes.funFact: Did you know? This castle is so important that the whole world helps protect it!

quizzes.question: Where does Ghana's president work and make big decisions?
quizzes.funFact: Fun fact! This building is also called Jubilee House and it looks super fancy!

quizzes.question: Where did Ghana celebrate becoming a free country in 1957?
quizzes.funFact: Wow! Ghana was the first country in sub-Saharan Africa to become independent!

quizzes.question: Which park has a bridge almost as tall as a 10-story building?
quizzes.funFact: Amazing! You can walk high in the treetops on a rope bridge called a canopy walkway!

quizzes.question: Who was Ghana's very first president?
quizzes.funFact: Did you know? Dr. Nkrumah helped many other African countries gain freedom too!

quizzes.question: Where does the president of Nigeria live and work?
quizzes.funFact: The villa sits at the base of a huge rock formation called Aso Rock in Abuja!

quizzes.question: Which famous Lagos building is shaped like a military hat?
quizzes.funFact: The National Theatre hosts plays, music, and dance — it was built in 1976!

quizzes.question: Which square in Lagos is named after a powerful woman trader?
quizzes.funFact: Madam Tinubu was a famous trader and leader who helped shape Nigerian history!

quizzes.question: Which Lagos park used to be a prison but is now a place for art and music?
quizzes.funFact: Freedom Park was turned from a colonial prison into a beautiful open space in 2010!

quizzes.question: Which ancient rock in Abeokuta was used as a fortress during wars?
quizzes.funFact: People once sheltered inside Olumo Rock's caves — you can still climb it today!

quizzes.question: Which famous palace in London has 775 rooms?
quizzes.funFact: The King lives here! Buckingham Palace has been the royal family's London home since 1837.

quizzes.question: Which bridge in London can open in the middle to let ships through?
quizzes.funFact: Tower Bridge opens about 800 times a year! It takes just five minutes to fully open.

quizzes.question: What is the famous clock tower at the Palace of Westminster called?
quizzes.funFact: Big Ben is actually the nickname for the Great Bell — the tower is called the Elizabeth Tower!

quizzes.question: Which circle of giant stones in England is about 5,000 years old?
quizzes.funFact: Nobody knows for sure how the enormous stones were moved — some came from over 150 miles away!

quizzes.question: What are London's famous red buses with two floors called?
quizzes.funFact: London's iconic red double decker buses have been around since 1956 and carry millions of passengers every year!

quizzes.question: What colour is the famous British telephone box?
quizzes.funFact: The red telephone box was designed in 1924 and became one of the most recognised symbols of Britain!

quizzes.question: What do you call the green rolling hills and villages outside British cities?
quizzes.funFact: The British countryside has stone walls, thatched cottages, and sheep-dotted hills that are hundreds of years old!

quizzes.question: Which giant green statue holds a torch and welcomes visitors to New York?
quizzes.funFact: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France in 1886 — she is over 300 feet tall!

quizzes.question: Where does the President of the United States live and work?
quizzes.funFact: The White House has 132 rooms, 35 bathrooms, and even a bowling alley and a movie theatre!

quizzes.question: Which famous red bridge stretches across the bay in San Francisco?
quizzes.funFact: The Golden Gate Bridge is painted a colour called 'International Orange' so ships can see it through the fog!

quizzes.question: Which giant white letters on a hillside are a symbol of the movie capital of the world?
quizzes.funFact: The Hollywood Sign originally said 'Hollywoodland' — it was an advert for houses in 1923!

quizzes.question: Which national park has geysers that shoot hot water into the sky?
quizzes.funFact: Yellowstone's Old Faithful geyser erupts about every 90 minutes — you can set your watch by it!
